multiple.description:
Whether the autocomplete allows multiple selections.
WARNING: This is currently incomplete and will not display selections, only data is returned.
Do not use this prop unless you are sure you know what you are doing.
multiple.name: multiple

value.description:
The currently selected value of the Autocomplete.
Single-select: undefined indicates no selection
value.name: value

inputValue.description: The current input value of the Autocomplete.
inputValue.name: inputValue

onInputChange.description: Callback invoked when the input value changes.
onInputChange.name: onInputChange

onBlur.description: Callback invoked when the input is blurred.
onBlur.name: onBlur

onFocus.description: Callback invoked when the input is focused.
onFocus.name: onFocus

inputEqualsOption.description:
Custom equality for input text to option mapping.
Defaults to case-sensitive label equality via getOptionLabel.
inputEqualsOption.name: inputEqualsOption

menu.description:
Data structure for the menu.
Observes a data hierarchy to determine elements, order, and grouping.
Accepts Sections, Options as top level objects in the array.
Actions may appear in both sections and options.
menu.name: menu

filterOptions.description:
Controls how options are filtered in response to the current input value.
- Omit to use the default case-insensitive substring match against labels using getOptionLabel
- Provide a function to implement custom filtering logic
- Set to `false` to opt out of filtering entirely (useful for async options)
filterOptions.name: filterOptions

getOptionLabel.description:
Used to determine the label for a given option, useful for custom data for options.
Defaults to  option.label.
getOptionLabel.name: getOptionLabel

debounce.description:
Debounce in milliseconds for input-driven filtering and search render.
Set to 0 to disable debouncing.
debounce.name: debounce

customRenderOption.name: customRenderOption

type.name: (args: { value: Value; isActive: boolean; isSelected: boolean; }) => ReactNode

customRenderSection.description:
Render prop to customize the rendering of a section.
@param args.section - The section value including all extra keys from the menu item
customRenderSection.name: customRenderSection

customRenderAction.name: customRenderAction

type.name: (args: { value: MenuAction<ExtraProps>; isActive: boolean; origin?: ActionOrigin; }) => ReactNode

customRenderHeader.description: Render prop to customize the rendering of header items.
customRenderHeader.name: customRenderHeader

customRenderFooter.description: Render prop to customize the rendering of footer items.
customRenderFooter.name: customRenderFooter

customRenderInput.name: customRenderInput

type.name: (props: { inputRef: Ref<HTMLInputElement | HTMLTextAreaElement>; inputProps: InputTextRebuiltProps; }) => ReactNode

UNSAFE_className.description:
**Use at your own risk:** Custom class names for specific elements. This should only be used as a
**last resort**. Using this may result in unexpected side effects.
More information in the [Customizing components Guide](https://atlantis.getjobber.com/guides/customizing-components).
UNSAFE_className.name: UNSAFE_className

type.name: { menu?: string; option?: string; section?: string; action?: string; input?: string; header?: string; footer?: string; }

UNSAFE_styles.description:
**Use at your own risk:** Custom style for specific elements. This should only be used as a
**last resort**. Using this may result in unexpected side effects.
More information in the [Customizing components Guide](https://atlantis.getjobber.com/guides/customizing-components).
UNSAFE_styles.name: UNSAFE_styles

type.name: { menu?: CSSProperties; option?: CSSProperties; section?: CSSProperties; action?: CSSProperties; input?: CSSProperties; header?: CSSProperties; footer?: CSSProperties; }

emptyStateMessage.description:
Render a custom empty state when the menu is empty.
NOTE: Do not put interactive elements in the empty state, it will break accessibility.
If you require interactive elements in the empty state, use the `emptyActions` prop.
To opt out of the default empty state message entirely use "false".
emptyStateMessage.name: emptyStateMessage

emptyActions.description:
Actions to display when there are no options to render after filtering.
Can be a static list or a function that derives actions from the current input value.
When provided and options are empty, these are rendered as navigable actions. Compatible with or without `emptyStateMessage`.
emptyActions.name: emptyActions

openOnFocus.description: Whether the menu should open when the input gains focus.
openOnFocus.name: openOnFocus

placeholder.description: The placeholder text for the input.
placeholder.name: placeholder

error.description:
Error message to display below the input
When present, invalid appearance applied to the input
error.name: error

invalid.description: Whether the input is invalid. Receives invalid appearance.
invalid.name: invalid

description.description: Description to display below the input
description.name: description

name.description: Name of the input for form submission
name.name: name

type.name: { onClick: () => void; readonly ariaLabel: string; readonly icon: IconNames; readonly label?: string; } | { ariaLabel?: never; onClick?: never; readonly label?: string; readonly icon?: IconNames; }

onOpen.description: Callback invoked when the menu opens.
onOpen.name: onOpen

onClose.description: Callback invoked when the menu closes.
onClose.name: onClose

loading.description:
Whether the menu is loading.
Displays glimmers in the menu
loading.name: loading

customRenderLoading.description: Custom render prop for content to render when `loading` is true.
customRenderLoading.name: customRenderLoading

isOptionEqualToValue.description: Custom equality for option to value mapping.
isOptionEqualToValue.name: isOptionEqualToValue

ariaLabel.description:
Defines a string value that labels the current element.
@see {@link https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.2/#aria-label}
ariaLabel.name: ariaLabel

ariaLabelledBy.description:
Identifies the element (or elements) that labels the current element.
@see {@link https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.2/#aria-labelledby}
ariaLabelledBy.name: ariaLabelledBy

ariaDescribedBy.description:
Identifies the element (or elements) that describes the object.
@see {@link https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.2/#aria-describedby}
ariaDescribedBy.name: ariaDescribedBy

ariaDetails.description:
Identifies the element (or elements) that provide a detailed, extended description.
@see {@link https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.2/#aria-details}
ariaDetails.name: ariaDetails

ariaInvalid.name: ariaInvalid

ariaRequired.description:
Indicates that user input is required before form submission.
@see {@link https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.2/#aria-required}
ariaRequired.name: ariaRequired

allowFreeForm.description:
Whether the autocomplete allows free-form input.
When true, the input value is not restricted to the options * in the menu. Input can be used to create a new value.
When false, the input value must match an option in the menu.
Input value will be cleared if no selection is made and
Whether the autocomplete allows free-form input.
When true, the input value is not restricted to the options in the menu. Input can be used to create a new value.
When false, the input value must match an option in the menu.
Input value will be cleared if no selection is made and focus is lost.
Whether the autocomplete allows free-form input.
When true, the input value is not restricted to the options in the menu. Input can be used to create a new value.
When false, the input value must match an option in the menu.
Input value will be cleared if no selection is made and focus is lost.
allowFreeForm.name: allowFreeForm

createFreeFormValue.description:
Factory used to create a Value from free-form input when committing. Necessary with complex option values. The only value the input can produce is a string.
@param input - The input value
createFreeFormValue.name: createFreeFormValue

onChange.description:
Callback invoked when the selection value changes.
This is called when we consider a selection "committed"
- The user presses enter
- The user clicks outside the menu with a selection typed
- The user clicks the clear button
The user clears a previous selection by deleting the input value
- The user selects an option with click or enter
- The user types a value that matches an option
- The user types a value that does not match an option and allowFreeForm is true
Callback invoked when the selection value changes.
onChange.name: onChange

type.name: ((value: AutocompleteValue<Value, Multiple>) => void) | ((value: AutocompleteValue<Value, Multiple>) => void)
